clinical_study.brief_title: Modification of the Human Colon and Oral Microbiome by Allogenic HSCT
clinical_study.official_title: Modification of the Human Colon and Oral Microbiome by Allogeneic HSCT in Recipients and Correlation With the Microbiome of the Donor

lead_sponsor.agency: Federal Research Institute of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology and Immunology

clinical_study.source: Federal Research Institute of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology and Immunology

brief_summary.textblock: Allogenic HSCT brings significant changes in biodiversity and composition of the gut microbiome through antibiotic usage, the mucosal damage due to the chemo- and radiotherapy toxicity; compromised oral nutritional intake and graft-versus-host disease with gut damage as the complication. Aim of the study is to investigate the composition of the microbiota in both recipient and nursing relative donor, reveal changes in biodiversity after HSCT via 3-time points V3V4 16S rRNA and NGS sequencing of the colon and oral swabs, 3-indoxyl-sulfate measurement in the urine.
